Is Stevia Ok For Diabetics 2017

Is Stevia Ok For Diabetics 2017?

For individuals with diabetes, finding suitable sugar substitutes can be a challenge. Stevia, a natural sweetener derived from the Stevia rebaudiana plant, has gained popularity in recent years as a sugar alternative. But is it safe for diabetics in 2017?

The good news is that stevia is generally considered safe for people with diabetes. It contains zero calories and does not raise blood sugar levels, making it an attractive option for those looking to manage their blood glucose levels. Additionally, stevia has a low glycemic index, meaning it does not cause a significant spike in blood sugar levels after consumption.

In fact, some studies have even suggested that stevia may have potential benefits for individuals with diabetes. Research has shown that stevia may help improve insulin sensitivity and reduce insulin resistance, both of which are important factors in managing diabetes. It may also help lower blood pressure, which is often a concern for individuals with diabetes.

However, it is important to note that not all stevia products are created equal. Some stevia products on the market may contain additives or fillers that can impact blood sugar levels. It is crucial to read labels and choose stevia products that are pure and free from additional ingredients.

As with any sugar substitute, moderation is key. While stevia is generally safe for diabetics, consuming excessive amounts may still have an impact on blood sugar levels. It is always best to consult with a healthcare professional or registered dietitian before making any significant changes to your diet.

In conclusion, stevia can be a suitable sugar substitute for individuals with diabetes in 2017. It is a natural sweetener that does not raise blood sugar levels and may even have potential benefits for managing diabetes. However, it is important to choose pure stevia products and consume it in moderation.
